alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and central Albany Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 528 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Creston Junction to 12 miles east of Sinclair to near Bow River Campground. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rawlins, Saratoga, Hanna, Sinclair, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Seminoe Campground, Battle Mountain, Bow River Campground, Seminoe Dam, Separation Lake and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 200 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
